sentences.en: All who pass by her scoff and shake their fists.
sentences.cn: 凡经过的人都必摇手嗤笑她.

sentences.en: Although some may scoff, it has been a remarkably compelling vision.
sentences.cn: 虽然有些人对之不屑一顾, 然而这一理念确实广受欢迎.

sentences.en: But observers scoff at such notions.
sentences.cn: 但是观察家对这种说法嗤之以鼻.

sentences.en: Citizens of other cities may scoff at Melbourne's brown river.
sentences.cn: 其他城市的居民或许会嘲笑墨尔本的褐色泥浆河.

sentences.en: He liked to scoff aloud at Louis XVIII.
sentences.cn: 他故意大声挖苦路易十八.

sentences.en: I was no more to her than a morsel of scoff in the fuel - house.
sentences.cn: 我在她的眼里还不如柴房里的一小堆木屑.

sentences.en: Ice cream was seen a suitable scoff for younger children.
sentences.cn: 冰淇淋被认为是适合小孩子的食品.

sentences.en: Some even scoff at the store's efforts to spruce up its image.
sentences.cn: 尽管沃尔玛努力改善公司形象,也有人将其拿来大加嘲讽.

sentences.en: Some experts scoff at that but admit that the reluctance exists.
sentences.cn: 有些专家对这种意识嗤之以鼻,但也承认这种不愿接受麻醉的心态依旧存在.

sentences.en: Still, some in the discount - airline industry scoff at the so - called - speed competition.
sentences.cn: 不过, 廉价航空业的一些人对 所谓 来自 高速 列车的竞争很不以为然.

sentences.en: There was purpose and feeling, banter and scoff playing, mingled , on her mobile lineaments.
sentences.cn: 在她那变幻无常的外貌上,既有决心,又有感情,既有嘲弄, 又有戏虐和开玩笑的神色.

sentences.en: Twenty and 10 every night is nothing to scoff at.
sentences.cn: 我们不能忽视他每晚20加10的表现.

sentences.en: Why do they scoff at the idea that he will retire next year?
sentences.cn: 他们为什么嘲笑他将在明年退休的想法?

sentences.en: You are not supposed to scoff at religion .
You may scoff but I honestly feel I'm being cruel only to be kind.
sentences.cn: 你可能不以为然，但我真的认为我狠下心来只是出于一片好意。

trans.tran_cn: 嘲笑, 嘲弄的话, 嘲弄的对象, 愚弄, 笑柄, 食品

trans.tran_en: to laugh at a person or idea, and talk about them in a way that shows you think they are stupid

trans.tran_cn: 嘲笑，嘲弄，掠夺，攫取，狼吞虎咽
